{"step_by_step_thinking": "The number of patients required in a clinical trial is determined by several factors. One of these factors is the significance level. Therefore, the number of patients required in a clinical trial would decrease, not increase, as the significance level increases. Hence, option B is incorrect. The drop-out rate (option A) and the incidence of the disease (option D) are not directly related to the number of patients required in a clinical trial.
